summary: An email chain from April 14, 2021, forwarding a potential lead regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. An Assistant United States Attorney shares contact information for a former NYPD detective now working in private security for an unnamed individual with homes in New York, Florida, and the Bahamas, who claims to have information and documents to share.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject about whom a private security contact claims to have information and documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject about whom a private security contact claims to have information and documents.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the forwarded email, offering to connect law enforcement with a private security contact who has a potential lead.

connections.description: Both are named together as subjects of the potential information and documents held by a private security contact.
The AUSA is facilitating a potential lead for law enforcement regarding Maxwell.
The AUSA is facilitating a potential lead for law enforcement regarding Epstein.

events.title: Potential Lead Forwarded to Law Enforcement
events.description: An email is forwarded among officials regarding a potential lead from a private security contact claiming to have information and documents on Epstein and Maxwell.

keyFacts: A former NYPD detective, now in private security for an unnamed client, claims to have information and documents regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The private security client has homes in New York, Florida, and the Bahamas.
An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is facilitating the contact for law enforcement follow-up.
The document is an internal email chain from April 2021, showing ongoing investigative efforts after Epstein's death and during Maxwell's prosecution.
